text: Draught at Gourmet Haus. Pours a pureed yellow with full white head. Massive juice on the aroma, doesnt quite follow through in the flavor. A little thin on the mouthfeel.

Gylden uklar skum hvid 
Citrus blomst tropisk frugt 
Bitter modrate sød lidt 
Tør livlig 
Cal SF

Keg at the brewery taproom. Pours unclear yellow-gold with a light, foamy white head. The nose has massive dank hop character, tropical fruits, cat piss. Medium sweet flavour, nicely dry but also dank, with notes of melon, grapefruit, peach. Light to medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Lightly resinous on the finish, with more dry and pithy citrus, pee, melon, grapefruit. Outstanding.
Hazy gold, no head. smells like white grape with lemons. juicy with a dry middle to finish like a pasty mouthfeel. cereal and almonds and a dry finish. flavor was great. mouthfeel missed it.

Draught at Cellarmaker, San Fransisco. Hazy/cloudy pale golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Heavenly hop aroma, peach, pine apples, some grapes. Hoppy pine flavor, peach, grapes, passion fruit, pine apples. Wonderful hop juice. Gbg Beer Week-clone? :)

Draft pour on tap at the brewery tap room (San Francisco, CA). Pours a hazy pineapple juice pour, glowing and murky, frothy whitish head atop sits around, filmy with good ringer atop that laces well. Aromas are a bit bitter, earthy, floral with some white grape, melon, bready malts as it settles. Initial is lighter bodied, a nice fruity melon flavor with some tropical wafts, cereal grainy and dry appeal. Some citric flashes, more florals, a kiss of tropical fruit. The green fruity melon up front tapers off as we press on but certainly leaves an impression. A bit earthy, mineral bitter appeal on we round the corner. Mellow tropical and melon flavors, sufficient bitterness and cleaner malt elements. A bit bready, subtle fruity nectar, bitterness as we round it all out. A more mellow nose, solid pour, flavors that pop up front tapering to a more bitter backend and finish. Nice stuff.
(Tap) cloudy yellow colour with a small white head; aroma of citrus, melon; then dankness; intense, balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish
At brewery. Pours a hazy pale yellow. Dank aroma with hints of apricot and white wine. Medium bitterness. Great Nelson showcase.
Great pale ale - assertive hop aroma and flavor without being very bitter. Stanky and tropical, refreshing and super flavorful, almost juicy.

Small pour at a tasting, consumed on 5-7-16. Nice, grassy, hay-like aroma. A bit of funk in an otherwise fresh smell. Cloudy liquid. Beige head. Looks good. Dirt-like, funky, dry, earthy-hoppy, muddy taste. Light to medium body.
Bottle. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Pleasant hoppy aroma. Tasty with pine & grassy hop notes dominate. Refreshing with good balance, body and mouthfeel.

650 mL bottle. Very hazy yellow. Smells of tropical hops with some floral notes. Light herbal and pine bite behind it. Tastes very bright and juicy. Strong garlicky bite behind it. None of the herbal notes. Light cracker malt and a strong bitterness. Lingering sweetness. Very light body. Aggressive hop profile. I like it.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2016 Poured from a 22 oz bomber; I?m so happy they are bottling now. Aroma is very hop forward with a medium light malt backbone with cracker and biscuit as well as some bready yeast notes. Lots of melon and tropical fruit with some dank resin notes. Light white wine and stone fruit notes. Pours a very cloudy, murky, pale yellow straw color with a medium sized, moderately thick white head that shows good retention as it slowly recedes. Medium high lacing and small legs. Flavor is slightly sweet with a dry finish. Moderately strong cracker and biscuit malt notes with some bready yeast characteristics. Medium to medium high bitterness. Lots of melon, mango, guava and other tropical fruit. Some light onion dank notes with hints of citrus. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. Overall, I love nelson sauvin hops and while this isn?t the greatest exhibition of them it?s still a great pale ale. Nice malt backbone that adds some character, especially in the flavor.

Aroma of dank herbal hops, grains... Flavor is amazingly smooth, herbal hop notes, grass, grains, like a saison but a pale... I love Nelson sauvin hops!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22oz bottle picked up at the brewery 
Pours cloudy yellow with a medium sized white head, good lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, dank hops and tangerines. Flavors of tropical fruit, grapefruit, leafy hops and dank 
A great pale ale.

Like attracts like is a rule of thumb in organic chemistry. Dishwashing detergents for cleaning greasy plates are a classic example. Cellarmaker often uses the same aroma hop both in the kettle for bittering and in cold tanks for flavoring, even when they arent classified as dual purpose like Nelson Sauvin. My speculation is that essential oils from the aroma hops in the kettle "prime the pump" for better extraction of the essential oils of the aroma hops in the cold tanks. But what do I know? I know that the fruity/floral flavors in the April 2016 batch of Mt. Nelson have tremendous resonance (thunder thiols?), based on my "beer belch" test. Another in a long line of cloudy masterpieces...
Oh my god this is great. Dank stinky resinous pine bits of cereal and whear, oof. Gnarly. Lemon and grape. Wow. Lightly spritzy medium light body. Light bitterness in the finish

On tap @ Cellarmaker. Dank grapefruit, orange, and tangerine. Really nice melon as well. Definitely a bit of the onion and garlic. Sweet peaches are quite prominent as well as a touch of melon. Good orange peel bitterness with a touch of pine and woody herbs. Some nice grapefruit and herbal character, too. Just overall intense and dank.

Draft at Cellarmaker. Pours a hazy pale gold color with a small white head with that settles into a ring. Big, dank aroma. Like hop pellets up the nose. Pale and crackery malts, straw, pepper, weed, pine, and grapefruit zest. Light-bodied, with moderate to medium carbonation and a really dry mouthfeel. Could smell and sip this one all day. Outstanding APA.

[1/27/16] Draught at Cellarmaker in San Francisco. Cloudy yellow. Great hoppy aroma full of tropical fruits and some onion. Dry flavor with moderately bitter fruity, "green" and oniony hops. Medium-bodied.

Tap at the Brewpub. Deeply cloudy and thick pastel gold color with thick lace. Huge Nelson nose, honey and biscuits, melon, maybe a bit of diacetyl. Huge fop flavor. Very bitter, also very sweet and creamy. Too creamy and oily for me. Crazy and interesting.

Keg at Cellarmaker, 28/01/16. 
Hazed golden orange with a decent off white cap.
Nose is dank hop, pine, bitter citric shreds, grapefruit.
Taste comprises pine needle, dank hop strokes, orange pith, grain, toasted bread, grapefruit flesh.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with hop bitterness.
Solid dank Pale chug jus,
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Keg @ Cellarmaker. Hazy golden pour with a modest white head. Nose is wonderfully expressive. Big juicy white grape jelly. A bit of dank greenery. Dirty grass. Grapefruit meat. Restrained malt character. Moderately bitter. Very dry finish. Chalky white grape jelly. Pale fruit skin. Light body, soft carbonation. This is fantastic.

Draft to pint at Cellarmaker. Looks good; a very hazy pineapple with white head. Smells and tastes of LOADS of juicy hops with a mildly bittersweet backbone. A hint of unaversive biscuit on the tongue as well. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and pleasant. Awesome juice!
On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazy yellow gold with small white head that lasts. The aroma is pineapple, dank? Medium mouth, dank, pineapple, so juicy, really enjoyed this.
Draft - Super weedy and grassy.  Cloudy gold with a white head.  Bitte, sweet and tons of grassy weedy notes.  Great.

On tap at cellarmaker San Francisco. pours out a cloudy pale golden topped with a small white head. nose is great hop kick nelson rich hop and a nice malt sweetness. taste is more of the heavy hops and a great balance. A melon and light bitterness on the end.

On tap at Cellarmaker. Hazy pale gold pour with lacy white head. Aroms of typical Nelson, fruity, very tropical, with light white wine notes, litchi, mild dankness. Taste is bitter, juicy with lingering grassy finish. Palate is med-light bodied with smooth silky carbonation. Very good, but not the citrasaic.

Draught at Cellarmaker. Light hazy deep hay yellow liquid with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, lemon peel, onion, weed, light grain and tangerine. Taste is very light sweet and light bitter with notes of citrus, tangerine, onion and grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice but oniony.
On tap at Final Gravity. Pours cloudy blonde with a nice white head and aclight floral aroma. There is a hearty pale malt flavor with a very dry moderately bitter finish.

draft at Mikkeller Bar, San Francisco, CA. First Cellarmaker beer that led to heading over to the brewery. Great flavorful pale, lots of tropical fruit, some grassy, sauvignon blanc notes, green apple. Very nice

UPDATED: APR 13, 2016 The beer is a darkened yellow. Very cloudy. Smallish head, kinda soapy. The aroma is full of hops, tropical and fruity. Lemon, pineapple, grape, big floral note, some pine. Wonderful mineral flavor in the taste. Just full of hop flavor. Moderate to light bitterness. Juicy and excellent. Really nice feel. Smooth with nice body from the minerality.  Edit: Re-rating based on bottle.  I think this beer really needs to warm up a bit before the full hop flavor comes out.  I probably drank it a bit cold at the brewpub.

Growler fill from the brewery.
An exceptional example of a single hop Nelson pale. Taste is heavier than most pales, so much in fact it could pass for an IPA. Heavy notes of straw, barnyard, and tropical fruit on the nose. Taste is full of dry straw with guava, banana, and unripe crab apples. Would buy again.

On draft at Cellarmaker. It pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. The aroma is lightly tropical with mango and grass. Light bodied with more grass, spicy hops, big sweet topical notes of lime, mango and melon. Medium acidity. The hop flavor is in overload. Really good stuff.
